description: Code identifying the maintenance template or task master that this nesting definition belongs to (e.g., a specific inspection/test program).
Sequence number controlling the order in which nested templates/tasks are applied or evaluated within the parent template.
Identifier for the nested template/group referenced by the parent; indicates which sub-template is included (e.g., N1); likely a code rather than free text; confirm with SME.
Free-text description of the nesting group or rule to clarify its purpose or contents.
Numeric factor applied to the nested item (e.g., repeat count, quantity, or weighting) when generating work or costs; exact usage may vary; confirm with SME.
Y/N flag indicating the nested item is mutually exclusive with other options in the same sequence; if set, only one should be selected or scheduled.

Indicator specifying whether to apply the nested templateâ€™s tasks as-is when creating work, versus copying or expanding them differently; exact behavior may depend on configuration; confirm with SME.
Identifier of the user or process that created this record for auditing.
Timestamp when the record was created (system time).
Identifier of the user or process that last modified this record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
